quizconfig.Name: Biology POST UTME
quizconfig.description: Past Question on Biology for POST UTME for more than 10 years
quizconfig.Author: Soligbo Emmanuel
topics: Forms in which living cells exist
Cell structure and functions of cell components
The Cell and its environment: Physical and Biophysical processes
Properties and functions of the living cell
Skeleton and supporting systems in animals
Sense Organs: Structure and function of the eye and ear
Morphological variations in the physical appearance of individuals
Transmission and expression of characteristics in organisms. Chromosomes: The basis of heredity
sex determination and sex linked characters. Application of the principles of heredity in Agriculture and Medicine

questions.question: A uniform solid cube material 10cm on each side of mass 700g is submerged in water. which of the following best described the behavior of the cube water?
questions.optiona: the cube will melt after a period of time
questions.optionc: the cube will sink in water
questions.optiond: the cube will rest at an equilibrium position in water
questions.correction: For the uniform cube 10cm volume = 10 x 10 x 10 = $10^3cm^3$ Mass = 700g ∴ density = (Mass)/Volume = (700)/100 = 0.7gcm-3 since the density is less than the density of water, the cube will float

questions.question: At low humidity in an environment, the human skin is usually?
If the relative density of gold is 19.2, the volume of 2.4kg of gold is?
questions.correction: R.D = (density of the subs)/density of water 19.2 =(P)/10^3 ; ∴P = 19.2 X 10^3 But Vol. = (Mass)/density = (2.4)/19.2 x 10^3 = $1.25 x 10^{-4} m^3$

questions.question: The thermometric property of a constant volume thermometer is?
questions.correction: The thermometric property of a constant volume thermometer is change in pressure with temperature

questions.question:
An immersion heater rated 2.0A, 240V is used to boil water from temperature 52°c to 100°c. If the mass of the water is 2.5kg. determine the time taken to boil the water.

[specific heat capacity of water = $4.2 x 10^3 jkg{-1} k^{-1}]$
questions.correction: Power of heater = lvt = 2 x 240 x t heat required to boil the water = Mct = 2.5 x 4.2 x 10^3 x (100.52) = 2.5 x 4. 2 x 10^3 x 48 2 x 240 x t = 2.5 x 4.2 x 10^3 x 48 ∴ t = (2.5 x 4.2 x 103 x 48)/2 x 240 = 1050s or $1.05 x 10^3s$

questions.question: The thermos flask is designed to?
questions.optiona: prevent heat loss or gain by conduction,convection and radiation
questions.optionc: prevent heat gain by conduction, convection and radiation
questions.optiond: prevent head lost conduction, convention and radiation

questions.question: what is likely to happen if the glass of a thermometer expands more upon heating than the liquid inside?
questions.optionc: the liquid will rise up in the stem
questions.optiond: the liquid will go down in the stem

questions.question: A drop of petrol makes a finger colder than a drop of water would because?
questions.optiona: petrol takes its latent heat of veporization from the finger
questions.optionb: petrol takes its latent heat of fusion from the finger
questions.optionc: water is more viscious than petrol
questions.optiond: water has higher surface tension dan petrol

questions.question: A cell of internal resistance r is connected to an external resistor R. The conductor for maximum power transfer is?
questions.correction: p is the time rate of expending energy. for electrical energy, P = IV; 1^2R or (V)/R. For a cell of constant e.m.f (voltage) maintaining constant current(1) through the circuit, P α R; OR (1)/R. Again for maxi. power,p α R And with respect to the opinion, maxi power would be transferred when R>r:not necessarily R = 2r

questions.question: The production and type of charge of a body can only be accounted for by the?
The main purpose of the transformer in an a.c radio set is to?
questions.optionc: convert energy from a.c to d.c

questions.question: An electric heater with a p.d of 240 V connected across its terminals has a total resistance of 960Ω. find the power rating of the heater.
questions.correction: Electrical power = IV or I^2R or (V)/R With V = 240v, R = 960Ω Power (V^2 )/R = (240 X 240)/960 =60Watts

questions.question: If the capacitance of an capacitor is C = (εA)/d, which of the following parameters is varied when a variable capacitors is used for tuning radio sets?
When an a.c. voltage is applied to a capacitor, no power is consumed because the current
questions.optiond: and voltage are $180^°$ out of phase
questions.correction: In a capacitive circuit, current leads voltage by $90^o$, or voltage lags current by$90^o$
